info.name: CoinMarketCap
info.description:
The CoinMarketCap Professional API is a suite of high-performance RESTful JSON endpoints that are specifically designed to meet the mission-critical demands of application developers, data scientists, and enterprise business platforms.

Contact Support:
 Name: No Contact
 Email: email@example.com

item.name: listings
item.description: Endpoints to list cryptocurrencies with historical and latest data.

item.name: List all cryptocurrencies (historical)
item.description: Get a paginated list of all cryptocurrencies with market data for a given historical time.

query.description: Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to return historical cryptocurrency listings for.
Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.
What field to sort the list of cryptocurrencies by.
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies against the specified sort.
The type of cryptocurrency to include.

item.name: List all cryptocurrencies (latest)
item.description: Get a paginated list of all cryptocurrencies with the latest market data.

query.description: Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.
What field to sort the list of cryptocurrencies by.
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies against the specified sort.
The type of cryptocurrency to include.

item.name: quotes
item.description: Endpoints to retrieve market quotes for cryptocurrencies, both historical and latest.

item.name: Get market quotes (historical)
item.description: Returns an interval of historic market quotes for any cryptocurrency based on time and interval parameters.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs.
Pass one or more comma-separated cryptocurrency symbols.
Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to start returning OHLCV time periods for.
Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to stop returning OHLCV time periods for.
Optionally limit the number of time periods to return results for.
Optionally adjust the interval.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols.

item.name: Get market quotes (latest)
item.description: Get the latest market quote for 1 or more cryptocurrencies.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs.
Pass one or more comma-separated cryptocurrency symbols.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols.
One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"
Alternatively pass one or more comma-separated cryptocurrency symbols. Example: "BTC,ETH". At least one "id" *or* "symbol" is required.

request.description:
Fetches comprehensive static metadata for one or more cryptocurrencies. This includes essential details such as the name, symbol, logo, and URLs related to the cryptocurrency's official resources, including websites, social media, and forums. This metadata is crucial for applications that require up-to-date static information for various cryptocurrencies. The endpoint ensures high availability with frequent updates.

**Available API Plans:**
- Starter
- Hobbyist
- Standard
- Professional
- Enterprise

**Cache / Update Frequency:**
Static data is refreshed only when necessary, with a minimum interval of every 30 seconds.

item.name: Get CoinMarketCap ID map
item.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all cryptocurrencies by their unique CoinMarketCap IDs. This endpoint is ideal for identifying and mapping cryptocurrencies to their CoinMarketCap IDs, which are used across multiple API endpoints. Ticker symbols may vary or overlap across cryptocurrencies, making this ID map a reliable reference for consistent integration.

Key Features:
- Supports both active and inactive cryptocurrencies.
- Offers flexible pagination with 'start' and 'limit' parameters.
- Filters results by specific symbols for targeted searches.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use this endpoint to maintain a consistent identifier across your application for cryptocurrencies.
- Filtering by symbols ensures that only relevant cryptocurrencies are returned, saving bandwidth and processing time.

**Available Plans:**
- Starter
- Hobbyist
- Standard
- Professional
- Enterprise

query.description: Specify the status of cryptocurrencies to retrieve. Use 'active' for currently traded coins and 'inactive' for coins no longer traded. Default is 'active'.
Offset the starting point of the list to retrieve paginated results. This is a 1-based index.
Define the maximum number of cryptocurrencies to return in the response. Use this in combination with the 'start' parameter for pagination.
Filter the results by specifying one or more cryptocurrency symbols as a comma-separated list (e.g., 'BTC,ETH'). At least one 'id' or 'symbol' is required.

item.name: Get market pairs (latest)
item.description:
Retrieve a comprehensive list of market pairs for a specified cryptocurrency, including associated trading stats such as volume, price, and pair information. The endpoint supports filtering by cryptocurrency ID or symbol and allows pagination for easier data handling.

Key Features:
- Retrieves active trading pairs (open for trading) for the given cryptocurrency.
- Offers optional conversion of stats into specified fiat or cryptocurrency symbols for added flexibility.
- Supports pagination using 'start' and 'limit' parameters.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use this endpoint to analyze trading pairs and their statistics for a cryptocurrency.
- The 'convert' parameter enables multi-currency data retrieval in a single call.

**Available Plans:**
- Standard
- Professional
- Enterprise

**Cache / Update Frequency:** Every ~1 minute.

query.description: Specify one or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs (e.g., "1,2") to retrieve market pairs for.
Alternatively, specify one or more comma-separated cryptocurrency symbols (e.g., "BTC,ETH"). At least one 'id' or 'symbol' is required.
Offset the starting point of the list to enable pagination. This is a 1-based index.
Define the maximum number of market pairs to return in the response. Use this with 'start' for pagination.
Specify up to 32 fiat or cryptocurrency symbols, separated by commas, for conversion of stats.

item.name: List all exchanges (historical)
item.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all cryptocurrency exchanges with historical market data for a given point in time. This endpoint is particularly useful for analyzing past trading volumes and exchange rankings.

Key Features:
- Retrieves historical market data for cryptocurrency exchanges.
- Supports pagination to fetch specific subsets of data.
- Provides options to filter and sort data by various criteria such as market type or sort direction.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use the 'convert' parameter to include fiat or cryptocurrency conversions in the response.

**Availability:** This endpoint is planned for release in Q3 2018.

query.description: Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to return historical cryptocurrency listings for.
Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.
What field to sort the list of cryptocurrencies by.
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies against the specified sort.
The type of exchange markets to include in rankings.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: List all exchanges (latest)
item.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all cryptocurrency exchanges with their latest 24-hour trading volume. This endpoint provides data to analyze current exchange activity and rankings.

Key Features:
- Fetches current market data for exchanges, including trading volume.
- Supports sorting by 24-hour volume or other ranking fields.
- Offers the option to convert data into specified fiat or cryptocurrency symbols.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use the 'convert' parameter to obtain multi-currency data in a single call.
- Filter results using 'start' and 'limit' for better pagination control.

**Available Plans:** Standard, Professional, and Enterprise.

query.description: Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.
What field to sort the list of cryptocurrencies by.
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies against the specified sort.
The type of exchange markets to include in rankings.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Get market quotes (historical)
item.description:
Retrieve historical market quotes for a cryptocurrency exchange based on specified time intervals and parameters.

Key Features:
- Provides combined 24-hour volume for all market pairs at each historical interval.
- Displays the number of market pairs available during the specified time period.
- Returns data in USD with additional currency conversion options available in future releases.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use the 'time_start' and 'time_end' parameters to define the time range for historical quotes.
- Adjust the 'interval' parameter to customize the frequency of returned data.

**Technical Details:**
- If 'time_start' is not supplied, the interval will be applied in reverse from 'time_end'.
- If 'time_end' is not supplied, it defaults to the current time.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"

Alternatively, one or more comma-separated exchange names in URL friendly shorthand "slug" format (all lowercase, spaces replaced with hyphens). Example: "binance,gdax". At least one "id" *or* "slug" is required.
Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to start returning OHLCV time periods for.
Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to stop returning OHLCV time periods for (exclusive). Optional, if not passed we'll default to the current time.
Optionally limit the number of time periods to return results for. The default is 10 items. The current query limit is 10000 items.
Optionally adjust the interval that "time_period" is sampled. See main endpoint description for available options.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Get market quotes (latest)
item.description:
Retrieve the latest 24-hour volume quotes for one or more cryptocurrency exchanges, including options for multi-currency conversions.

Key Features:
- Provides real-time 24-hour trading volume data for exchanges.
- Supports conversion to multiple fiat and cryptocurrency values.
- Useful for monitoring exchange performance and volume trends.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use the 'convert' parameter to fetch market values in various currencies in a single call.
- Specify exchanges using their CoinMarketCap 'id' or 'slug'.

**Availability:**
This endpoint is available on Standard, Professional, and Enterprise plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Data is updated approximately every 5 minutes and will transition to ~1-minute updates shortly.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"

Alternatively, one or more comma-separated exchange names in URL friendly shorthand "slug" format (all lowercase, spaces replaced with hyphens). Example: "binance,gdax". At least one "id" *or* "slug" is required.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Get metadata
item.description:
Retrieve static metadata for one or more cryptocurrency exchanges. Metadata includes essential details such as the logo, homepage URL, and other static information.

Key Features:
- Provides static data for exchanges, including unique identifiers, logos, and URLs.
- Useful for identifying and referencing exchanges in applications.

**Usage Notes:**
- Specify exchanges using their CoinMarketCap 'id' or URL-friendly 'slug'.
- Supports multiple IDs or slugs in a single request.

**Availability:**
This endpoint is available on Hobbyist, Standard, Professional, and Enterprise plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Data is updated only as needed, typically every 30 seconds.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"

Alternatively, one or more comma-separated exchange names in URL-friendly shorthand "slug" format (all lowercase, spaces replaced with hyphens). Example: "binance,gdax". At least one "id" *or* "slug" is required.

item.name: Get CoinMarketCap ID map
item.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of cryptocurrency exchanges with their unique CoinMarketCap IDs. This endpoint is designed to facilitate the identification and referencing of exchanges across various endpoints.

Key Features:
- Provides a convenient lookup for exchange IDs.
- Supports filtering results by listing status (active/inactive) and URL-friendly 'slug'.
- Allows pagination for tailored queries.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use this endpoint to match exchanges by their IDs or slugs.
- Supports filtering to include only active or inactive exchanges.

**Availability:**
This endpoint is available on Hobbyist, Standard, Professional, and Enterprise plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Data is updated dynamically, ensuring relevance and accuracy.

query.description: Only active coins are returned by default. Pass 'inactive' to get a list of coins that are no longer active.

Alternatively, one or more comma-separated exchange names in URL-friendly shorthand "slug" format (all lowercase, spaces replaced with hyphens). Example: "binance,gdax". At least one "id" *or* "slug" is required.
Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.

item.name: List all market pairs (latest)
item.description:
Retrieve a comprehensive list of active market pairs for a specific exchange. Active market pairs indicate trading activity is ongoing. This endpoint supports currency conversion and pagination for detailed and customized queries.

Key Features:
- Lists market pairs actively trading on the specified exchange.
- Includes details for up to 32 fiat or cryptocurrency conversions.
- Pagination enables tailored results with adjustable start and limit parameters.

**Usage Notes:**
- Ideal for fetching up-to-date market trading pairs.
- Supports filtering using exchange IDs or slugs.

**Availability:**
This endpoint is available on Standard, Professional, and Enterprise plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Updates every ~5 minutes, transitioning to ~1-minute updates shortly.

query.description: One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"

Alternatively, one or more comma-separated exchange names in URL-friendly shorthand "slug" format (all lowercase, spaces replaced with hyphens). Example: "binance,gdax". At least one "id" *or* "slug" is required.
Optionally offset the start (1-based index) of the paginated list of items to return.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Use this parameter and the "start" parameter to determine your own pagination size.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Get aggregate market metrics (historical)
item.description:
Retrieve historical aggregate market metrics, including 24-hour trading volume and market capitalization data, for specified time intervals. This endpoint provides insights into the market's historical trends and performance.

Key Features:
- Returns aggregate metrics for specified time ranges.
- Includes options for interval sampling and fiat or cryptocurrency conversions.

**Usage Notes:**
- Suitable for analyzing market performance over historical periods.
- Supports customizable start and end times for precise data retrieval.

**Technical Details:**
- A quote is returned for each interval between "time_start" and "time_end".
- If "time_start" is omitted, the interval applies in reverse from "time_end".
- Defaults to the current time if "time_end" is omitted.

**Availability:**
- Available on applicable API plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Data is updated as per historical intervals.

query.description: Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to start returning OHLCV time periods for.
Timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to stop returning OHLCV time periods for (exclusive). Optional, if not passed we'll default to the current time.
Optionally limit the number of time periods to return results for. The default is 10 items. The current query limit is 10000 items.
Optionally adjust the interval that "time_period" is sampled. See main endpoint description for available options.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Get aggregate market metrics (latest)
item.description:
Retrieve the latest aggregate market metrics, including current global trading volume and market capitalization. This endpoint provides a snapshot of the market's overall health and trends.

Key Features:
- Provides up-to-date aggregate market data.
- Allows conversion into fiat or cryptocurrency values for comprehensive analysis.

**Usage Notes:**
- Ideal for obtaining real-time global market performance data.
- Use the "convert" parameter to retrieve values in preferred fiat or cryptocurrency units.

**Availability:**
- Accessible on applicable API plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Data updates approximately every 5 minutes, with plans to transition to 1-minute updates.

query.description: Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.

item.name: Price conversion tool
item.description:
The Price Conversion Tool endpoint allows you to convert an amount of one currency (cryptocurrency or fiat) into equivalent amounts in up to 32 other currencies at once, using real-time exchange rates.

Key Features:
- Supports cryptocurrency and fiat currency conversions.
- Optionally includes historical price conversions by specifying a timestamp.

**Usage Notes:**
- Use the `amount` parameter to specify the value to convert.
- Provide either a `symbol` or `id` to indicate the source currency.
- Use the `convert` parameter to specify the desired output currencies.

**Limitations:**
- Historical fiat conversions are not currently supported; the latest fiat rates will be used for conversions.

**Availability:**
- Accessible on supported API plans.

**Cache/Update Frequency:** Rates are updated frequently to reflect real-time market data.

query.description: An amount of currency to convert. Example: 10.43
One or more comma-separated CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs. Example: "1,2"
Alternatively pass one or more comma-separated cryptocurrency symbols. Example: "BTC,ETH". At least one "id" *or* "symbol" is required.

Optional timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to reference historical pricing during conversion. If not passed, the current time will be used. If passed, we'll reference the closest historic values available during conversion.
Pass up to 32 comma-separated fiat or cryptocurrency symbols to convert the source amount to.
